channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Apple announces iPhone event for Sept. 9
item.description: The launch event will be streamed on Apple's website and YouTube.

item.title: Amazon aggregators Branded and Heyday plan to merge as once-booming industry continues to shrink
item.description: The Amazon aggregator space, which faltered after venture capital money dried up and consumers returned to stores, continues to consolidate.

item.title: This high-income region has the least active people globally, WHO report shows
item.description: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.

item.title: How Trump was 'orange-pilled' by three bitcoiners in Puerto Rico and the promise of $100 million
item.description: Getting Donald Trump to keynote the year's biggest bitcoin conference took the work of three friends from Puerto Rico.

item.title: Who is Telegram founder Pavel Durov — and why was he arrested?
item.description: The Paris Public Prosecutor's Office issued an arrest warrant for Durov in connection to an investigation opened on July 8.

item.title: What is mpox and why has the WHO declared it a public health emergency?
item.description: Here's what we know about the latest mpox outbreak.

item.title: India wants to be a developed nation by 2047 — but it has to tackle gender inequality first
item.description: Entrenched sexism still persists in India and the country will need to tackle the obstacle to achieve its economic goals, economic experts say.

item.title: UBS veteran boss Ermotti may have pulled off the deal of the decade with the Credit Suisse rescue
item.description: After an intense weekend of negotiations in March 2023, UBS agreed to buy its embattled rival Credit Suisse. But not everyone was convinced it was a good idea.

item.title: Europe stocks close mixed as investors weigh risk of wider Middle East conflict
item.description: European stocks traded in mixed territory on Monday, as traders assessed the risk of rising tensions in the Middle East.

item.title: Trump waffles on Harris debate on ABC News, Democratic nominee wants hot mics
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is scheduled to debate Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, Sept. 10 on ABC News.

item.title: Tesla’s Optimus faces stiff humanoid competition at Beijing robot conference
item.description: While Chinese companies last week showed off human-like robots playing the zither or grabbing sodas, Tesla displayed its Optimus humanoid inside a clear box.

item.title: I’m from Japan, home to some of the world’s longest living people: The No. 1 beverage I drink every day
item.description: Nutritionist and longevity expert Michiko Tomioka shares what she drinks every day to promote longevity, inspired by her experiences growing up in Nara, Japan.

item.title: Here's how to harvest 0% capital gains amid the latest stock market rally
item.description: You can leverage the 0% capital gains bracket to harvest profits, rebalance your portfolio or save on future taxes. Here's what investors need to know.

item.title: China slams U.S. for adding firms to export control list over alleged support for Russian military
item.description: The U.S. on Friday said it is tightening export controls to "further restrict the supply of both U.S.-origin and 'U.S. branded' items to Russia and Belarus."

item.title: New, deadlier mpox found in Thailand: These Asian nations have ramped up precautions
item.description: More cases of the dangerous strain has been identified outside the African continent.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia's 'drop-the-mic moment'
item.description: Wall Street rallies on Powell's rate cut signal. Intel calls in advisors for activist defense. China slams U.S. over export ban.

item.title: Trump says Musk wouldn't have time to be in his White House cabinet, but could 'consult'
item.description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have formed an unlikely alliance ahead of the 2024 election against Kamala Harris.

item.title: Fed Chair Powell indicates interest rate cuts ahead: 'The time has come for policy to adjust'
item.description: Powell laid the groundwork for interest rate cuts ahead, though he declined to provide exact indications on timing or extent.

item.title: Meta says it found WhatsApp accounts linked to Iranian hackers targeting Biden, Trump officials
item.description: Meta said it blocked a "small cluster" of WhatsApp accounts linked to an Iranian hacking group targeting U.S. officials.

item.title: Boeing Starliner returning empty as NASA turns to SpaceX to bring astronauts back from ISS
item.description: Boeing will return its capsule from the International Space Station without the NASA astronauts that Starliner delivered to orbit.

item.title: Intel has hired Morgan Stanley, other advisers for activist defense
item.description: With its stock down almost 60% this year, Intel is gearing up to defend itself against pressure from activist investors.

item.title: Bank of England's Bailey: 'More restrictive policy' could still be needed due to labor market shocks
item.description: Bailey will say he currently places more weight on "the degree of restriction we have in place today easing off over time."

item.title: Mike Lynch, man once dubbed 'Britain's Bill Gates,' dies at age 59
item.description: Mike Lynch, who had just recently won a landmark U.S. fraud trial, was found dead in the wreckage of a yacht that sank off the coast of Sicily. He was 59.

item.title: Microsoft plans September cybersecurity event to discuss changes after CrowdStrike outage
item.description: Industry participants will discuss the idea of relying more on a safer part of Windows than the privileged kernel mode that CrowdStrike software uses.

item.title: The big mistake that can leave you ‘highly disappointed’ with your vacation, says travel agent for billionaires
item.description: Jaclyn Sienna India, a travel agent for the mega-rich, says billionaires and everyday spenders make this common mistake when planning their vacations.

item.title: National Cheap Flight Day: Follow these 3 tips to find affordable airfare
item.description: Don't let the name fool you, prices aren't cheaper on National Cheap Flight Day.

item.title: What a Harris election victory could mean for Europe and the trans-Atlantic relationship
item.description: Analysts at the Economist Intelligence Unit said they expect the substance of Harris' position on major international issues to be similar to that of Biden's.

item.title: Workday stock gains as software provider widens 2027 margin target
item.description: While Workday trimmed subscription software growth guidance, it surprised analysts by calling for a higher adjusted operating margin.

item.title: Nestle CEO departure seen as 'not such a bad thing' for investors, analyst says
item.description: Nestle has replaced its CEO Mark Schneider with company veteran Laurent Freixe in a bid to shake up its fortunes.

item.title: No longer a financial reservoir? Saudi Arabia’s spending confirms clear shift in strategy
item.description: The kingdom's $925 billion sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund, saw its assets jump 29% in 2023 — and domestic investment was a major driver.
